Nadeem, I patched your PR and tested. It worked as described, but I suggest the following changes:
 If you change "Run on Interpreter Server" method then how can we execute workflows? so we should add a total different menu item to run a simple applications. Just leave all the workflow tabs as is and create a new top level menu next to Amazon like "Run Applications" and then say execute application which will call the API methods.

Hi Suresh, 
I have added a new menu for launching applications, restoring the previous functionality of "Run on Interpreter Server" menu option for workflows. I have also made creation of workflows optional for launching single applications i.e. user can just drag drop the application and execute it, without the need of adding and connecting input and output nodes. Application execution also works if input output nodes are added.
AIRAVATA-1442

This pull request is updated and now contains following items, in addition to the ones mentioned above:
5. Updated the airavata-default-xacml-policy in order to cater the current authorization requirements in PGA, as discussed in the dev list.
6. Updated the secure client sample to showcase the capabilities of the updated authorization policy.
7. Added the policy administration client (PAP) into the secure solution of airavata server, which publishes and enables the authorization policy in the WSO2 IS via its API, during the startup of airavata server - if the security is enabled.

Thanks,
Hasini.

Added sge, 
I ignored the maximum number of nodes value because I couldn't find the option in SGE and used serial as parallel environment as used on ROCKS clusters. Other users should create a parallel environment named serial using <qconf -ap serial>.
Closing the pull request as the content needs to be refactored.

I noticed this after merging the PR, do not commit the target folder to git. Also, always do a git rebase before you submit a PR.

let me change cloud module version for you.
get a git pull now and it will have 0.17-SNAPSHOT.
@shamrath  I have made some design changes in orchestrator. Should I make those changes again after the git pull as none of my changes have been merged yet.

Your local changes preserve with git pull, sometimes you will get conflicts with remote code changes, which you need to fix and commit again. Anyway as a best practice and avoid a lot of merge conflicts it is always good to keep you code sink with the remote repository.
@shamrath  I just did a rebase. I think Travis CI should work now
could you also run git merge airavata:develop and make sure there are no any conflicts? BTW hope your git branch code is sync with airavata git develop branch.
@shamrath Yes, My branch is in sync with airavata git develop branch.

As far as I can tell, the issue is not related to my AMQPWSTunnel module. It isn't built by maven (the module is entirely in Python), and the Travis CI build failure seems to be related to retrieving something from WSO2. Can we go ahead and merge this to get the module into Airavata?

Closing this pull request due to merge conflicts, will create a new branch with updated code

Hi Anuj 

Followings are few suggestions to improve your pull request. 
1. We can do this in a better way by adding generic API method(to AiravataAPIServer) like "getAllCredentialSummary" instead of adding API method for each credential types eg: "getAllGatewaySSHPubKeysSummary" which will return all the credential summary for that particular gatewayId. You may be able to remove few redundant methods from Airavata API server.
2. Let's introduced one credential summary struct to all credential types, how we differentiate is we have credential type enum field( SSH, PASSWD, CERT etc ) in the credential summary thrift struct. 
3. Move credential data model thrift file to data model directory and merge credential summary thrift file with it. 
4. Credential stubs still have date fields in generated thrift files, not because your changes, but we need to fix it so remove it.

Very nice list of improvements. I was penciling some of these for a API review, but good that you are suggesting to get them done now. 

+1 for all 4 suggestions. 

Suresh
